title: Heavy rainfall batters Odisha; IMD issues red alert for these districts
text:
2 Min Read
Heavy rain battered Odisha on Thursday (October 2) as the depression in the Bay of Bengal intensified into a deep depression and is moving towards the coast. The IMD has issued a 'red' warning of above 20-cm rainfall in Puri and Jagstingpur districts in Odisha, an 'Orange' warning (7 cm to 20 cm rain) for 14 districts, and a 'Yellow' warning (7 cm to 11 cm rain) for the remaining 14 districts.
The IMD said the deep depression formed on Wednesday (October 1) night over the Bay of Bengal is moving towards the coast with a speed of 17 kmph.
“The system at 5.30 am on Thursday lay centered at about 190 km south-southeast of Gopalpur, 190 km east-southeast of Kalingapatnam (Andhra Pradesh), 230 km south of Puri (Odisha), 250 km east of Visakhapatnam (Andhra Pradesh) and 310 km south-southwest of Paradip (Odisha),” it said.
The system is very likely to cross Odisha and adjoining Andhra Pradesh coasts between Gopalpur and Paradip by the night of October 2, the IMD said.
The IMD has predicted heavy rainfall over West Bengal, Sikkim, and Bihar till October 6; Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, and parts of Madhya Pradesh till October 4.
A fresh intense western disturbance is likely to affect the Northwest region from October 5 to 7.
The weather department said isolated to scattered rainfall is very likely over the Northwest region until October 4 and would increase thereafter. It said isolated heavy rainfall is expected over East Uttar Pradesh till October 6; Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, West Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan from October 5 to 7.
The IMD said moderate rain at many places with isolated heavy rainfall is likely over the Northeast region till October 4. Very heavy rainfall is expected over Assam and Meghalaya till October 3.
In the southern region, light to moderate rain at many places with isolated heavy rainfall likely over Tamil Nadu till October 4. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is expected over Coastal Andhra Pradesh and Yanam today.
The IMD said heavy rainfall is likely over Saurashtra & Kutch today.
